byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Rappeport, Yamiche Alcindor, Jason Horowitz and Colin Moynihan.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and JONATHAN MARTIN

abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders struggles to unify delegates at Democratic National Convention following leak of emails that showed that party officials apparently schemed to help Hillary Clinton win presidential nomination; other speakers, including Elizabeth Warren and Michelle Obama, try to placate party's left wing in attempt to rally convention for Clinton.

headline.print_headline: Democrats Fight to Pull Together on an Unruly Day
headline.main: Democrats Struggle for Unity on First Day of Convention

snippet: Supporters of Bernie Sanders, who lost to Hillary Clinton, booed when he urged them to vote for her despite revelations of bias by party leaders....
lead_paragraph: Supporters of Bernie Sanders, who lost to Hillary Clinton, booed when he urged them to vote for her despite revelations of bias by party leaders.
